author: Pulse News Agency Local By NAN
title: 2017 Lagos City Marathon: 7-year-old completes 10km
text: A seven-year-old, Damilola Oluwaseun , became the spotlight of the   Marathon when she finished completed 10km of the 42km race. Oluwaseun, who joined the race at 32km which is at the end of Lekki Bridge, said she was elated to have ran 10km. “ I feel happy that I was able to run the 10km, it was not easy but it was worth trying. It feels good ,’’ she said. The race started at the National Stadium, Lagos and finished at the Eko Atlantic City. The News   reports that no fewer than 64 foreign and 102 local elite athletes participated in the race that registered 55,000 runners from 27 countries, including Nigeria. The top place winner will cart away 50,000 dollars, second place 40,000 dollars and third place 30,000 dollars respectively. Abraham Kiptom and Rhoda Jepokorir of Kenya won the international male and female categories. Philip Sharabutu also defended the first Nigerian male title and Emmanuel Gyang came second in the Nigerian male category. Tweet
